intro: Astragalus neilreichianus, commonly known as Neilreich's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to drought conditions, showcasing a deep root system for water absorption. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, are pollinated by various insects, including bees and butterflies. Astragalus neilreichianus is also valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
